revised_title: On the Circulation of the Blood and the Sphygmograph-Trace
tldr: The author presents a series of measurements and experiments to study the circulation of blood and the sphygmograph-trace. They establish a relationship between the cardiosystole, sphygmosystole, and pulse-beat, and introduce the concept of "syspasis," the time taken by the ventricle to elevate its internal pressure before the aortic valve opens. The author also describes the use of a double sphygmograph to measure the time taken for pulse-waves to travel between different arteries.
